channel.title: Comments on: Do you have Chimney Offload State disabled?
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.content:encoded:
output
Querying active state…
NULL
TCP Global Parameters
———————————————-
Receive-Side Scaling State : enabled
Chimney Offload State : automatic
NetDMA State : enabled
Direct Cache Acess (DCA) : disabled
Receive Window Auto-Tuning Level : normal
Add-On Congestion Control Provider : none
ECN Capability : disabled
RFC 1323 Timestamps : disabled
** The above autotuninglevel setting is the result of Windows Scaling heuristics
overriding any local/policy configuration on at least one profile.
NULL
NULL

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Yes on my workstation I also have it set to automatic

Here is the output from a command prompt

TCP Global Parameters<br />
----------------------------------------------<br />
Receive-Side Scaling State          : enabled<br />
Chimney Offload State               : automatic<br />
NetDMA State                        : enabled<br />
Direct Cache Acess (DCA)            : disabled<br />
Receive Window Auto-Tuning Level    : normal<br />
Add-On Congestion Control Provider  : none<br />
ECN Capability                      : disabled<br />
RFC 1323 Timestamps                 : disabled<br />
** The above autotuninglevel setting is the result of Windows Scaling heuristics<br />
overriding any local/policy configuration on at least one profile.

item.title: By: David Forck (thirster42)
item.dc:creator: David Forck (thirster42)
item.description: on my dev server it's set to automatic.
item.content:encoded: on my dev server it’s set to automatic.
